entry.title: S/4 Cloud: Local Event Consumption not getting triggered
entry.content:
Hi community,

we are on a S/4H Cloud system and we want to consume a standard business event locally.

This is described here (creating a class which is defined for events of a business object interface + a local class with a method to consume a certain event of it):
https://help.sap.com/docs/abap-cloud/abap-rap/business-event-consumption?locale=en-US

Unfortunately the handler method never gets called.

Is there something we are missing? Something to activate a certain event?

I'm used to work with event mesh on BTP (where stuff like communication arrangement SAP_COM_0092, channel binding etc. is necessary on the system).  I thought that local consumption (without going to BTP Event Mesh) does not need anything additional (only a class with a method which is handling the event). Am I wrong?

Thank you
Daniel

entry.title: MIGO BADI in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am looking for a BADI/Enhancement Spot during MIGO ( Standard App : Post Goods Receipt for Purchasing Document). I  know in SAP ECC we have BADI MB_DOCUMENT_BADI which can be leveraged to perform custom functionalities with method MB_DOCUMENT_UPDATE, but not able to find any such released BADI when working in SAP S/4 public cloud edition. 

I know there are some released BADI to check the data for header and line item data but didn't find any which triggers during/after posting the document. In short, I need to print a label once material document is created in the system.

Thank you in advance for the help.

entry.title: SAP PUBLIC CLOUD ABAP EML Defintion
entry.content:
When I use the BOI operation process and components of the production order, how should I define the type to create a table corresponding to the content in %target?
The code is as follows:

    MODIFY ENTITIES OF i_productionordertp
    ENTITY productionorderoperation
    CREATE BY \_operationcomponent
    AUTO FILL CID
    FIELDS ( material
             billofmaterialitemcategory
             requiredquantity
             baseunit )
    WITH VALUE #(
         ( %key-orderinternalid = '0000001161'
           %key-orderoperationinternalid = '00000001'
           %target = VALUE #(
           ( material = |{ '2' ALPHA = IN WIDTH = 18 }|
             %data-billofmaterialitemcategory = 'L'
             %data-requiredquantity = 22
             %data-baseunit = 'KG'
             %data-StorageLocation = '131A' )
                            )
         )
                )
    FAILED DATA(failed)
    REPORTED DATA(reported)
    MAPPED DATA(mapped).

entry.title: When I called BAPI_SALESORDER_CHANGE, "Update was canceled" received from author "CHENG_MR".
entry.content:
When I called BAPI_SALESORDER_CHANGE, the internal table RETURN did not contain any error messages. However, immediately after execution, a popup appeared saying:

"Express document 'Update was canceled' received from author 'CHENG_MR'"

Why did this happen? Below is the code I wrote.

DATA : ls_partner          TYPE bapiparnr,
       lt_return           TYPE TABLE OF bapiret2,
       Lt_PARTNER          TYPE TABLE OF bapiparnr,
       ls_partnerchanges   TYPE  bapiparnrc,
       Lt_PARTNERCHANGES   TYPE TABLE OF bapiparnrc,
       ls_partneraddresses TYPE  bapiaddr1,
       lv_order_header_inx TYPE  bapisdh1x,
       Lt_PARTNERADDRESSES TYPE TABLE OF bapiaddr1.

DATA: lv_adrnr TYPE kna1-adrnr.

SELECT SINGLE adrnr INTO lv_adrnr
  FROM kna1
  WHERE kunnr = '0000001100'.


CLEAR:lt_return,lt_partner.
lv_order_header_inx-updateflag = 'U'.

ls_partner-partn_role  = 'AG'.

ls_partner-partn_numb  = '0000001100'.
ls_partner-country     = 'CN'.
ls_partner-name        = 'laogao'.
ls_partner-postl_code = '112222'.
ls_partner-city       = 'chang'.
ls_partner-street      = '222222'.
ls_partner-telephone   = '1777777777'.
APPEND ls_partner TO lt_partner.
CLEAR:ls_partner.


ls_partnerchanges-updateflag = 'U'.
ls_partnerchanges-document   = '1100000397'.
ls_partnerchanges-itm_number = '000000'.
ls_partnerchanges-partn_role = 'AG'.
ls_partnerchanges-p_numb_old = '0000001100'.
ls_partnerchanges-p_numb_new = '0000001100'.
*ls_partnerchanges-addr_link  = lv_adrnr.
APPEND ls_partnerchanges TO lt_partnerchanges.
CLEAR ls_partnerchanges.

ls_partneraddresses-country = 'CN'.
*ls_partneraddresses-addr_no = lv_adrnr.
ls_partneraddresses-name    = 'ruirui'.
ls_partneraddresses-tel1_numbr  = '16666666666'.
ls_partneraddresses-street  = 'Street'.
ls_partneraddresses-postl_cod2  = '010704'.
APPEND ls_partneraddresses TO lt_partneraddresses.
CLEAR ls_partneraddresses.

CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_SALESORDER_CHANGE'
  EXPORTING
    salesdocument    = '1100000397'
    order_header_inx = lv_order_header_inx
  TABLES
    return           = lt_return
    partners         = lt_partner
    partnerchanges   = lt_partnerchanges
    partneraddresses = lt_partneraddresses.

CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT'
  EXPORTING
    wait = 'X'.


REFRESH:lt_partner,lt_partnerchanges.

entry.title: Need Help Mapping Tax Entries to Supplier Invoice Items–Issue in Developing Purchase Register Report
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

We are in the process of developing a custom Purchase Register report in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, and are encountering several challenges in retrieving accurate tax information at the invoice item level. Despite leveraging standard CDS views, we are unable to establish a reliable linkage between tax entries and their corresponding document items—which is critical for our reporting requirements.

Purpose of the Requirement
The goal is to build a Purchase Register report that provides a consolidated view of:

  • Supplier invoice line items

  • Tax amounts (eligible and ineligible)

  • Freight and asset item taxes

  • Proper item-wise tax segregation and traceability

This report is essential for GST compliance, input tax credit (ITC) auditability, and monthly financial reporting. However, the current limitations in CDS views are hindering this development.

Key Issues Faced

Case 1: Ineligible Tax – Missing Item-Level Field

  • No dedicated item-level field exists for capturing ineligible tax amounts.

  • The available tax CDS views do not return these tax entries, making it difficult to retrieve or calculate the correct tax per invoice item.

Case 2: Freight as a Separate Line Item

  • When freight is posted separately, the tax CDS views do not clearly map the freight tax to the original invoice item.

  • Since both the invoice and freight line may share the same item number, it's impossible to distinguish the tax details per line.

Case 4 & 5: Asset Item – Tax Posting Per Quantity

  • For asset purchases, tax is posted per quantity (e.g., 3 units = 3 tax lines).

  • This leads to a mismatch between item numbers of the invoice and the tax entries.

  • As a result, we cannot reliably link each tax entry to the correct item in the billing document, breaking traceability and affecting report accuracy.

CDS Views Evaluated

We have tried the following:

  • I_OperationalAcctgDocItem
    Used to retrieve item-level data for supplier invoices, but lacks direct tax linkage.

  • I_SupplierInvoiceTaxAPI01
    Evaluated, but it does not provide the expected item-level breakdown or association to the correct invoice lines.

Help Needed From Community

We are looking for your expert suggestions on:

  • Any alternate CDS views that offer more granular linkage between invoice item and tax lines.

  • Recommended approaches or best practices to model or join tax data effectively for such scenarios.

  • Relevant SAP Notes, documentation, or workarounds followed in Public Cloud environments.

Any support, guidance, or shared experiences would be greatly appreciated to help us unblock this critical development.

Thank you in advance!

Kind regards,
Tasneem Ahmad Karimi

Let me know if you'd like a version with your company name, SAP tenant ID, or further formatting.

entry.title: Automatic Batch/Serial No Determination in vl01n
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

 

We are automating batch and serial number determination during outbound delivery.

  • Batch should be determined automatically.

  • Serial numbers (received from a third-party system and stored in a custom table) should be assigned automatically when navigating to Extras → Serial Numbers.

For batch determination, I found the exit USEREXIT_BATCH_DETERMINATION.
Could you please suggest which exit or BAdI can be used for automatic serial number assignment?

Is there any Other ways to approach this requirement?

entry.title: S/4HANA Public Cloud 2502: Custom tile for Custom UI5 application with parameters
entry.content:
Dear SAP experts,

I have an issue with the Fiori app Display Line Item Entry (F2218) , which does not accept the URL parameters "P_FromPostingDate" and "P_ToPostingDate".

In on-premise systems I was able to solve this by creating a new tile as a copy of the standard one and adding the required parameters.

The problem is that in S/4HANA Public Cloud there is no SAP Fiori Launchpad Designer, so I cannot create a new tile in this way.

I used the following reference to create a Custom Tile, but this only works for external applications and does not allow me to add new parameters.

¿How can I create a tile with parameters in S/4HANA Public Cloud 2502?

Thank you very much.

Best regards,

entry.title: Skip step in flexible PO workflow
entry.content:
Hello Everyone,

We have a requirement to implement Flexible PO approval process. We have a bespoke table with three levels of approval. Therefore, we have written logic in BADI-MMPUR_WORKFLOW_AGENTS_V2 for agent determination. The approval rationale is like below.
Variance  -  difference between the standard price of the material and the item's net price.

If the difference is between 30% and 50%, go to approver 1.
If there is a difference between 50% and 90%, go to approvers 1 and 2.
If GT 90%, go to approvers 1 + 2 + 3.

Three-level approvals are predefined in the Manage Workflows in Purchase Orders steps.

 

We have a scenario where variance is falling between 30-50 which means we will have only 1 level approval.  So when control goes to level 2 , the approvers table will be empty and as agent determination is mandatory the system throws an exception. Ideally when condition is satisfied rest of the steps need to be skipped ( level 2 and 3 in this case ).

Currently we have a condition at workflow level as we need automatic approval if the variance is less than 30%.

Since BADI only allows for one condition ID (SWF_WORKFLOW_CONDITION_DEF), we are unable to add another condition for step-level control.

We are at a standstill and unable to proceed, went through relevant blogs but was unable to find anything.
Has anyone worked on a requirement like this before?

Please let me  if any information is needed further.

Thank you

Regards,

Karthik

entry.title: Sap_payslip_de_o Hrforms payslip custom/copied infostar sign conversion
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

I am working on Germany SAP payslip i.e sap_payslip_de_o in Hrforms

For custom changes i had copied the payslip in z* form.

For convenience i had copied some standard infonets then copied some stardard infostars to differentiate the wagetypes.

But if i am maintaining the wagetype in the infostar provided by SAP i am getting correct sign expected,

But if i am copying the same sap infostar and maintaining the wagetype there i am not getting correct sign expected.

 

Where should i need to maintain the sign conversion rule for that and ,please let me know the path.

Thanks in advance 

HCM Payroll #hcm germany #hr abap ABAP Development #hcm payslip
